episodeTitle: Wait for Luffy! Mortal Combat on the Bridge of Hesitation!
episodeTitleJapanese: ルフィを待て！ためらいの橋の死闘！
episodeTitleRomanized: Rufi o Mate! Tamerai no Hashi no Shitō!
description: The intense battle between Luffy and Rob Lucci reaches a critical moment as Luffy appears to gain the upper hand, only for Lucci to unleash his ultimate technique, the Rokuougan, in his leopard hybrid form. As Luffy collapses to the ground seemingly defeated, Usopp makes a dramatic choice by removing his Sogeking mask and revealing his identity to encourage Luffy to stand up and continue fighting. Meanwhile, the rest of the Straw Hats face off against a massive Marine army on the Bridge of Hesitation.

openingSong.title: Crazy Rainbow
openingSong.titleJapanese: クレイジーレインボー

events.title: Luffy Gains Upper Hand Against Lucci
events.description: As the battle between Luffy and Rob Lucci continues to rage on, Luffy appears to gain the upper hand in their fierce confrontation. Using his Gear Second techniques, Luffy presses his advantage against the CP9 agent, giving hope to his watching crewmates that victory may be within reach.
events.significance: Represents a turning point in the battle where Luffy seems close to victory, setting up the dramatic reversal when Lucci unleashes his ultimate technique. This false hope makes the subsequent defeat more impactful.

events.title: Luffy Uses Gomu Gomu no Jet Bullet
events.description: Luffy employs the Gomu Gomu no Jet Bullet technique, a powerful Gear Second attack that combines his rubber abilities with high-speed movement. The attack demonstrates Luffy's enhanced combat capabilities in his Gear Second state against the formidable Rob Lucci.
events.significance: Showcases one of Luffy's Gear Second techniques during this crucial battle, demonstrating his evolution as a fighter and the arsenal he has developed to face CP9's strongest agent.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy unleashes a Gear Second technique against Lucci

events.title: Luffy Unleashes Twin Jet Pistol
events.description: Luffy demonstrates another powerful Gear Second technique, the Twin Jet Pistol, attacking Rob Lucci with two simultaneous high-speed punches. This double attack puts additional pressure on Lucci and shows Luffy's versatility in combat.
events.significance: Further demonstrates Luffy's mastery of Gear Second and his ability to adapt his classic techniques with enhanced speed and power. The twin attack format shows tactical thinking in overwhelming a powerful opponent.

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Jet Axe Strikes Lucci
events.description: Luffy executes the Gomu Gomu no Jet Axe, bringing his leg down on Rob Lucci with tremendous force enhanced by Gear Second's speed. The powerful axe kick continues Luffy's offensive assault in this climactic battle.
events.significance: Showcases the variety of Gear Second techniques Luffy has developed, including enhanced versions of his standard attacks. The Jet Axe demonstrates that Luffy can apply the Gear Second enhancement to kicks as well as punches.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy delivers a powerful axe kick to Lucci

events.title: Marines Attack the Bridge of Hesitation
events.description: A massive Marine army launches an assault on the Bridge of Hesitation where the Straw Hat Pirates are positioned. The Marines use cannon fire from surrounding battleships in an attempt to destroy the bridge's pillars and prevent the pirates' escape with Nico Robin.
events.significance: Escalates the danger facing the Straw Hats by adding a secondary threat while Luffy battles Lucci. Forces the crew to split their attention between protecting the bridge and waiting for Luffy to finish his fight.

events.title: Straw Hats Face Off Against Marine Army
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates, minus the incapacitated Chopper and missing Sanji, face off against the massive Marine army attacking the Bridge of Hesitation. Zoro, Nami, and Franky must defend their position while waiting for Luffy to defeat Lucci and complete the rescue of Robin.
events.significance: Demonstrates the crew's unity and determination to protect each other despite overwhelming odds. The crew must hold their ground and trust in Luffy to finish his battle, showcasing the bonds between the Straw Hats.

events.title: Rob Lucci Unleashes Ultimate Rokuougan
events.description: Just when Luffy seems to have gained the upper hand, Rob Lucci unleashes his ultimate technique - the Rokuougan (Six King Gun) - enhanced to maximum power through his Neko Neko no Mi, Model: Leopard hybrid form. The devastating attack is a close-range shockwave created by two enlarged fists, representing the secret seventh technique of Rokushiki that only masters can perform.
events.significance: Introduces the ultimate Rokushiki technique and demonstrates why Lucci is CP9's strongest agent. The Rokuougan represents the pinnacle of the Six Powers martial arts system and poses the greatest threat Luffy has faced in the battle. This is the attack that nearly defeats Luffy completely.

quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Lucci unleashes his ultimate attack on Luffy

events.title: Luffy Collapses from Rokuougan
events.description: After being hit by Rob Lucci's ultimate Rokuougan attack enhanced by his leopard hybrid form, Luffy collapses to the ground, bloodied and seemingly defeated. He lies motionless on the bridge, unable to get up, while his crewmates watch in horror from their position. The devastating attack appears to have pushed Luffy beyond his limits.
events.significance: Represents the lowest point in the battle for Luffy and creates the most dramatic tension in the Enies Lobby arc. This moment of apparent defeat sets up Usopp's crucial intervention and Luffy's final rally. It demonstrates the true power of CP9's strongest member.

events.title: Usopp Removes Sogeking Mask and Reveals Identity
events.description: In one of the most emotionally powerful moments of the arc, Usopp removes his Sogeking mask and reveals his true identity to encourage the fallen Luffy. Despite having left the crew and adopted a disguise to help from afar, Usopp casts aside his pride and anonymity, calling out to Luffy by name and shouting for him to get up. This is the first time Usopp has dropped the Sogeking persona in front of Luffy during the arc.
events.significance: This is one of the most significant character moments for Usopp in the entire series. By removing his mask, Usopp sets aside his pride and the emotional barriers that formed during Water 7, showing his genuine care for Luffy and the crew. The act symbolizes Usopp taking responsibility and showing his true self when it matters most. It's a crucial step toward Usopp's eventual reunion with the crew.

quotes.text: Luffy! Get up! You have to get up!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp removes his Sogeking mask and desperately calls out to the fallen Luffy

events.title: Luffy Recognizes Usopp Without the Mask
events.description: When Usopp removes his Sogeking mask and calls out to him, Luffy manages to turn his head slightly and look at Usopp. In this moment, Luffy realizes that it is Usopp standing there and not Sogeking, though his reaction is left ambiguous as to whether this is the first time he's made this connection or if he knew all along.
events.significance: This moment adds depth to the Luffy-Usopp relationship and the running gag about whether Luffy knew Sogeking's identity. It shows Luffy's recognition of his friend despite their estrangement, and this recognition becomes part of what gives Luffy the strength to continue fighting.

events.title: Usopp's Desperate Taunting Strategy
events.description: After revealing himself, Usopp attempts to draw Rob Lucci's attention away from the fallen Luffy by taunting the CP9 agent. He claims to have eight thousand followers and makes other outrageous lies in classic Usopp fashion. Though Lucci initially ignores him, Usopp continues taunting until he finally grabs Lucci's attention, causing the assassin to turn toward him threateningly.
events.significance: Shows Usopp's characteristic bravery despite overwhelming fear - he's willing to sacrifice himself to buy time for Luffy to recover. This moment demonstrates growth from the cowardly sniper who left the crew, showing that even though he's terrified, he'll put himself in danger for his captain and friends.

quotes.text: I have eight thousand followers! You better not underestimate me!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp desperately tries to draw Lucci's attention with his characteristic lies

events.title: Luffy Reacts to Protect Usopp from Lucci
events.description: As Rob Lucci begins walking toward Usopp with threatening intent, the fallen and bloodied Luffy summons the strength to speak, telling Lucci to leave Usopp alone and to stop. Despite appearing completely defeated moments before, Luffy's protective instinct for his crewmate causes him to react, foreshadowing his upcoming final rally.
events.significance: This moment demonstrates that Luffy's bond with his crewmates gives him strength even when he appears to have none left. Usopp's intervention has succeeded in rekindling Luffy's fighting spirit. It sets up the final phase of the battle where Luffy will rise again to protect his friends and finish the fight.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Despite being seemingly defeated, Luffy reacts when Lucci threatens Usopp

events.title: Usopp's Encouragement to Stand and Fight
events.description: Usopp, having revealed his true identity, encourages Luffy to stand up once again and fight for his friends. He reminds Luffy of what they're fighting for - to save Robin and escape Enies Lobby together. Usopp's words of encouragement plant the seeds for Luffy's final rally against Lucci.
events.significance: This moment represents the emotional climax of the episode and sets up the resolution in episode 309. Usopp's words reach Luffy and begin to reignite his determination. It shows how the bonds between crewmates can overcome even the most desperate situations, which is a core theme of One Piece.

quotes.text: Stand up, Luffy! You have to fight! For Robin! For all of us!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp encourages Luffy to find the strength to continue fighting

events.title: Bridge Pillar Damaged by Marine Cannon Fire
events.description: The Marine battleships successfully damage the first pillar of the Bridge of Hesitation with their cannon fire, threatening to sever the section where Luffy is fighting from the rest of the bridge. This creates an additional time pressure as the structural integrity of the bridge becomes compromised.
events.significance: Adds urgency to the situation by creating a ticking clock element. Not only must Luffy defeat Lucci, but he must do so before the bridge collapses completely, potentially separating him from his crew or causing everyone to fall.

themes.description: The episode powerfully demonstrates how the bonds between crewmates can provide strength even in the darkest moments. Usopp's decision to reveal himself and encourage Luffy represents setting aside pride for the sake of friendship, while Luffy's reaction to protect Usopp despite being defeated shows how these bonds work both ways.
themes.symbolism: Usopp removing his mask symbolizes removing emotional barriers and showing one's true self. The mask represented his pride and separation from the crew, and removing it represents his willingness to be vulnerable and honest about his care for Luffy.

themes.description: Luffy pushing himself to the absolute limit against Lucci demonstrates that raw physical power alone is not enough. Even when Luffy appears to have the advantage with Gear Second, Lucci's ultimate technique proves overwhelming. The episode shows that victory requires not just strength but also the emotional support of friends.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's collapse represents the limits of individual power, while his reaction to Usopp's encouragement shows how bonds with others can help surpass those limits.

themes.description: Usopp's character arc reaches a crucial moment as he chooses duty to his friends over his pride. Having left the crew and hidden behind a disguise, Usopp finally faces the consequences of that choice and decides that Luffy's life is more important than maintaining his separate identity as Sogeking.
themes.symbolism: The Sogeking mask represented Usopp's attempt to help while maintaining distance. Removing it shows his acceptance that true friendship requires being present as oneself, not hiding behind personas.

themes.description: Even when faced with seemingly insurmountable odds and devastating defeat, the episode emphasizes the importance of perseverance. Usopp encourages Luffy to stand up despite impossible circumstances, and Luffy responds to protect Usopp despite having no apparent strength left.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's repeated attempts to rise despite being knocked down symbolizes the indomitable spirit that defines him as a protagonist and future Pirate King.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy reaches his lowest point in the battle against Lucci, appearing completely defeated after being hit by the Rokuougan. However, his instinctive reaction to protect Usopp when threatened shows that his spirit remains unbroken even when his body fails him. This episode demonstrates Luffy's greatest strength - his bonds with his crew.

mangaDifferences.difference: Episode 308 primarily adapts Chapter 426 titled 'A Ship Waiting for Wind', with some portions carrying over into Episode 309. The anime extends the battle sequences and Usopp's emotional moment of removing his mask with additional scenes and longer dramatic pauses compared to the manga.

The Marine assault on the bridge is given more screen time in the anime with additional action sequences showing the Straw Hats defending against the forces, compared to the manga's more streamlined presentation.

trivia.fact: Episode 308 aired on May 6, 2007, during the climax of the Enies Lobby arc, which is widely considered one of the best arcs in One Piece history.
The episode achieved a TV rating of 10.5% and ranked 4th in its time slot, demonstrating the arc's popularity with Japanese audiences during its original broadcast.

This episode features one of the most emotionally significant moments for Usopp's character, with his removal of the Sogeking mask being a pivotal moment in his character arc and his eventual reunion with the crew.

The Rokuougan technique introduced in this episode is described as the secret seventh technique of Rokushiki, accessible only to those who have mastered all six basic techniques. It represents the pinnacle of the CP9 fighting style.

The opening theme 'Crazy Rainbow' by Tackey & Tsubasa was used for episodes 284-325, covering the Enies Lobby and Post-Enies Lobby arcs. The duo was actually animated into the opening for Episode 303 to celebrate April Fool's Day in 2007.

This episode primarily adapts content from Chapter 426 of the manga, titled 'A Ship Waiting for Wind', continuing the pacing of roughly one chapter per episode that was standard during the Enies Lobby arc.

Rob Lucci's Neko Neko no Mi, Model: Leopard Devil Fruit is a Zoan-type that enhances his already formidable physical abilities and Rokushiki mastery. According to Lucci, carnivorous Zoan fruits are especially suited for combat.
